Lack enough support: The claim that a vaccine meant for cattle can be used to fight COVID-19 lacks support as there is currently no vaccine available for the novel coronavirus that causes the disease.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the vaccine used for bovine coronavirus can be effective against the new strain of coronavirus that emerged in 2019, which is a problematic assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the vaccine for bovine coronavirus is not effective in humans or against the new strain of coronavirus.
Understate: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim is understating any information.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim is exaggerating any information.
Falters at times: There is no evidence to suggest that the claim falters at times.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence to suggest that there is an alternative explanation for the claim.
